Technique: FORMED BY HAND; ENGRAVED; PAINTED; FAYENCE; ENGRAVED
Name: Shabti of Pakhaas
Description: This funerary statuette in green faience is in the name of the "chief of the troop" Pakhaas. Very remarkable shabtis of the same person are preserved in many  of the world's museums. They probably come from a tomb at Giza, today lost.  Like the majority of these shabtis, the Brussels example carries Chapter 6 of the Book of the Dead.
